sections.name: Giant Flea
sections.text: Giant fleas are commonly found in areas containing hardy megafauna, such as dinosaurs or mammoths.

sections.name: Flea
Flea Allies
sections.text: Flea swarms and giant fleas make for natural pets and monstrous minions for creatures who live in areas of filth and concentrated populations. Goblins and gremlins are unperturbed by fleas’ disturbing physiologies and are unfazed (though not necessarily unaffected) by the diseases these vermin carry. Ratfolk have been known to tame giant fleas for use as mounts, and urban-dwelling druids whose magic focuses on blight or disease naturally find much to like about the flea swarms they frequently summon.

sections.text: Fleas are little more than a nuisance in most circumstances, but can be lethal when they grow to monstrous proportions or gather in enormous swarms.

traits.name: Animal
traits.text: An animal is a creature with a relatively low intelligence. It typically doesn’t have an Intelligence ability modifier over –4, can’t speak languages, and can’t be trained in Intelligence-based skills.

affliction.name: Flea Fever

traits.name: Disease
traits.text: An effect with this trait applies one or more diseases. A disease is typically an affliction.

affliction.text: Drain from flea fever can’t be reduced or recovered from naturally until the disease is cured.

stages.name: Stage 1
stages.text: drained 1 (1d4 hours), Stage 2 drained 1 and sickened 1 (1 day), Stage 3 drained 2 and sickened 1 (1 day), Stage 4 drained 3 and sickened 1 (1 day), Stage 5 dead

ability.name: Suck Blood
ability.requirement: The giant flea’s last action was a successful proboscis Strike
ability.effect: The giant flea drinks the creature’s blood. The victim becomes drained 1 and the flea regains 5 HP.
